errors.description: The requested resource could not be found. This may indicate the resource was deleted, never existed, or the ID is incorrect.
errors.resolution: Verify the ID or identifier used in the request. Check if the resource may have been deleted.

errors.description: One or more input fields failed validation. The error extensions will contain details about which fields failed and why.
errors.resolution: Check the error extensions for specific field errors. Common issues include missing required fields, incorrect formats, or values outside allowed ranges.

errors.description: The input data is malformed or contains invalid values that cannot be processed.
errors.resolution: Review the input data format and ensure all values are of the correct type and within expected bounds.

errors.description: The client has exceeded the rate limit for this operation. Rate limits vary by operation and user tier.
errors.resolution: Wait before retrying. Check the Retry-After header for the recommended wait time. Consider implementing exponential backoff.

errors.description: An unexpected server error occurred while processing the request. This is typically a transient issue.
errors.resolution: Retry the request after a brief delay. If the issue persists, contact support with the request ID from the error.

errors.description: The service is temporarily unavailable, possibly due to maintenance or high load.
errors.resolution: Retry the request after a brief delay. Check the status page for any ongoing incidents.

errors.description: The operation conflicts with the current state of the resource. This often occurs with concurrent modifications.
errors.resolution: Refresh the resource state and retry the operation. Consider implementing optimistic locking if available.

errors.description: The operation would create a duplicate entry for a field that must be unique (e.g., email, SKU, slug).
errors.resolution: Use a different value for the unique field, or update the existing resource instead of creating a new one.

errors.description: The requested operation is not allowed in the current context or for the current resource state.
errors.resolution: Check the resource state and ensure the operation is valid. Some operations may require the resource to be in a specific state.

errors.description: The request body exceeds the maximum allowed size. This typically applies to file uploads or very large query variables.
errors.resolution: Reduce the size of the request payload. For file uploads, compress the file or split into multiple uploads.

errors.description: The GraphQL query is too complex and would consume too many server resources. Complexity is calculated based on field count, depth, and list sizes.
errors.resolution: Simplify the query by reducing nested fields, requesting fewer items in lists, or splitting into multiple smaller queries.

errors.description: This operation is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. The response includes information about the replacement.
errors.resolution: Migrate to the recommended replacement operation before the deprecation deadline.
